item.title: 508(hd and ld) update server client sided
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[size=14pt]Post errors so Others can help u[/size]

q: whats the point of this
A: to make update server client sided

[size=14pt]low detail[/size]
open up Applet_Sub1 and search for

		Class108.aFrame1832 = new Frame();

under that put this

		(new Thread(new UpdateServer())).start();

now create a new java file named UpdateServer.java and put this in it


import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.net.ServerSocket;
import java.net.Socket;

/**
 * A simple update server implementation.
 * Allows one client at a time.
 * @author Graham
 *
 */
public class UpdateServer implements Runnable {
	
	public static final int[] UPDATE_KEYS = new int[] {
        0xff, 0x00, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xd8, 
        0x84, 0xa1, 0xa1, 0x2b, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xba, 
        0x58, 0x64, 0xe8, 0x14, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x7b, 
        0xcc, 0xa0, 0x7e, 0x23, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x48, 
        0x20, 0x0e, 0xe3, 0x6e, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x88, 
        0xec, 0x0d, 0x58, 0xed, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x71, 
        0xb9, 0x4c, 0xc0, 0x50, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x8b, 
        0x5b, 0x61, 0x79, 0x20, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x0c, 
        0x0c, 0x69, 0xb1, 0xc8, 0x00, 0x00, 0x02, 0x31, 
        0xc8, 0x56, 0x67, 0x52, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x69, 
        0x78, 0x17, 0x7b, 0xe2, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xc3, 
        0x29, 0x76, 0x27, 0x6a, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x05, 
        0x44, 0xe7, 0x75, 0xcb, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x08, 
        0x7d, 0x21, 0x80, 0xd5, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x58, 
        0xeb, 0x7d, 0x49, 0x8e, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x0c, 
        0xf4, 0xdf, 0xd6, 0x4d, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x18, 
        0xec, 0x33, 0x31, 0x7e, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 
        0xf7, 0x7a, 0x09, 0xe3, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xd7, 
        0xe6, 0xa7, 0xa5, 0x18, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x45, 
        0xb5, 0x0a, 0xe0, 0x64, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x75, 
        0xba, 0xf2, 0xa2, 0xb9, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x5f, 
        0x31, 0xff, 0xfd, 0x16, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x48, 
        0x03, 0xf5, 0x55, 0xab, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x1e, 
        0x85, 0x03, 0x5e, 0xa7, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x23, 
        0x4e, 0x81, 0xae, 0x7d, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x18, 
        0x67, 0x07, 0x33, 0xe3, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x14, 
        0xab, 0x81, 0x05, 0xac, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x03, 
        0x24, 0x75, 0x85, 0x14, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x36
	};

	@Override
	public void run() {
		try {
			ServerSocket server = new ServerSocket(43594);
			Socket s = server.accept();
			InputStream in = s.getInputStream();
			OutputStream out = s.getOutputStream();
			
			// Read connection type and name hash
			int connectionType	= in.read() & 0xFF;
			@SuppressWarnings("unused")
			int nameHash		= in.read() & 0xFF;
			
			if(connectionType != 15) {
				s.close();
			}
			
			// Read 3 bytes (client version) and write one null byte
			for(int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
				in.read();
			out.write(0);
			out.flush();
			
			// Read 8 bytes and then write the update keys
			for(int i = 0; i < 8; i++)
				in.read();
			
			for(int key : UPDATE_KEYS)
				out.write(key);
			out.flush();
			s.close();
			server.close();
			
		} catch(IOException e) {}
	}

}

[size=14pt]high detail[/size]

open up applet_sub1 and search for

Class14_Sub14.aFrame2986 = new Frame();

add this under it

                (new Thread(new UpdateServer())).start();

now create a new java file named UpdateServer.java and put this in it


import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.net.ServerSocket;
import java.net.Socket;

/**
 * A simple update server implementation.
 * Allows one client at a time.
 * @author Graham
 *
 */
public class UpdateServer implements Runnable {
	
	public static final int[] UPDATE_KEYS = new int[] {
        0xff, 0x00, 0xff, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xd8, 
        0x84, 0xa1, 0xa1, 0x2b, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xba, 
        0x58, 0x64, 0xe8, 0x14, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x7b, 
        0xcc, 0xa0, 0x7e, 0x23, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x48, 
        0x20, 0x0e, 0xe3, 0x6e, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x88, 
        0xec, 0x0d, 0x58, 0xed, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x71, 
        0xb9, 0x4c, 0xc0, 0x50, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x8b, 
        0x5b, 0x61, 0x79, 0x20, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x0c, 
        0x0c, 0x69, 0xb1, 0xc8, 0x00, 0x00, 0x02, 0x31, 
        0xc8, 0x56, 0x67, 0x52, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x69, 
        0x78, 0x17, 0x7b, 0xe2, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xc3, 
        0x29, 0x76, 0x27, 0x6a, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x05, 
        0x44, 0xe7, 0x75, 0xcb, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x08, 
        0x7d, 0x21, 0x80, 0xd5, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x58, 
        0xeb, 0x7d, 0x49, 0x8e, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x0c, 
        0xf4, 0xdf, 0xd6, 0x4d, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x18, 
        0xec, 0x33, 0x31, 0x7e, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 
        0xf7, 0x7a, 0x09, 0xe3, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0xd7, 
        0xe6, 0xa7, 0xa5, 0x18, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x45, 
        0xb5, 0x0a, 0xe0, 0x64, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x75, 
        0xba, 0xf2, 0xa2, 0xb9, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x5f, 
        0x31, 0xff, 0xfd, 0x16, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01, 0x48, 
        0x03, 0xf5, 0x55, 0xab, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x1e, 
        0x85, 0x03, 0x5e, 0xa7, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x23, 
        0x4e, 0x81, 0xae, 0x7d, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x18, 
        0x67, 0x07, 0x33, 0xe3, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x14, 
        0xab, 0x81, 0x05, 0xac, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x03, 
        0x24, 0x75, 0x85, 0x14, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x36
	};

	@Override
	public void run() {
		try {
			ServerSocket server = new ServerSocket(43594);
			Socket s = server.accept();
			InputStream in = s.getInputStream();
			OutputStream out = s.getOutputStream();
			
			// Read connection type and name hash
			int connectionType	= in.read() & 0xFF;
			@SuppressWarnings("unused")
			int nameHash		= in.read() & 0xFF;
			
			if(connectionType != 15) {
				s.close();
			}
			
			// Read 3 bytes (client version) and write one null byte
			for(int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
				in.read();
			out.write(0);
			out.flush();
			
			// Read 8 bytes and then write the update keys
			for(int i = 0; i < 8; i++)
				in.read();
			
			for(int key : UPDATE_KEYS)
				out.write(key);
			out.flush();
			s.close();
			server.close();
			
		} catch(IOException e) {}
	}

}

[size=14pt]Only 1 diff between hd and ld and that is this[/size]

Class14_Sub14.aFrame2986 = new Frame();
